intro: Streptocarpus modestus, commonly known as the modest streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Streptocarpus modestus is also valued for its ability to produce numerous blooms throughout the growing season.
